tab.name: intro
tab.label: Summary
tab.content: Bath is one of the finest small cities in Britain. Catch the warm light of a fine morning on the elegant golden limestone facades of the Georgian town houses and you'll see why. Despite the historical grandeur it is a buzzing and busy place with loads of great cafes, museums and highly individual shops. Bath is wonderfully preserved, with plenty of fascinating hidden corners, making it the perfect place for a Treasure Hunt!

tab.name: details
tab.label: Hunt Info
tab.content:
Hunts The pack includes an easy and hard version of the main treasure trail and a bonus puzzle.

Duration 2 or 3 hours, not including breaks.

Suitability Suitable for any size of group from 1 to 8, good for families. The streets of Bath are accessible to all, though there are some hilly roads and a detour may be necessary to avoid steps.

Requirements Just a pencil and paper, and a sensible pair of shoes.

tab.name: todo
tab.label: Things to do
tab.content:
• Visit the Roman Baths, perhaps the best preserved Roman remains in Britain
  • Have a relaxing afternoon being pampered at Thermae Bath Spa
  • Explore the countryside and find the beautiful little Iford Manor
  • Visit in December to enjoy the Bath Christmas Market
